thread.section_title: Airwise - The Airport and Air Travel Guide
thread.title: United Flights Restart After Computer Problems
thread.title_full: United Flights Restart After Computer Problems

author: Reuters
title: United Flights Restart After Computer Problems
text:
United Airlines has resumed flights at all US airports after they were grounded due to computer problems, according to the Federal Aviation Administration. The FAA issued the order to prevent all United Airlines flights from taking off following a systemwide computer issue, which was resolved, the agency said.
The website FlightAware had the tally of delayed flights at 92.
United had experienced "network connectivity issues," an airline spokesman said.
United flights were also grounded on June 2 due to "automation issues."
(Reuters)
